narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The nature of the self from both a metaphysical and psychological perspective.

This class provided me with an amazing setting to learn about the philosophy of identity and psychological studies about identity. I learned a lot about the current topics of debate in this field as well as some different ways of resolving these debates. What was super interesting about this class was that these questions were also analyzed through a psychological lens. This means we read a lot of psychological literature, something I was less familiar with and I found super interesting. I also learned how to perform some basic psychological research via questionnaire on the final project, something I hadnt done before.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This class was pure strengths. Probably one of my favorite classes of all time. Profs Paul and Bloom had excellent readings that really provided space to engage in the discussion coming from both the psychological and philosophical perspective. The material was super engaging and entertaining, and I stayed completely focused for the entire 2 hour seminar every week because it was just that amazing.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)

Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: If you have the chance to take a class with either of these professors you should.

Yes, if you can take this class, take it! It was truly a transformative experience engaging in this material! The discussion was always amazing, and I just found the course as a whole super fulfilling!
